column4: I modified my sources.list and replaced dapper with edgy and upgraded and it didn't install networking
Now I have a remote server sitting without any ability of getting online
And it's 1800 miles away
That sure does suck, a little bit
well if you can't connect to it, then no
what sort of suggestion did you expect about fixing a remote server if its networking is not enabled?
is that server connected wirelessly?
I was hoping that I could revert to my old dapper install
lets assume that you can, how can you revert if you are not able to reconnect?
is it networked wirelessly?
No, it's an ethernet connection
it wasn't very smart to do a system-wide update without having direct access to the system
thats like attempting to "reinstall" Windows 1500 miles away
have that person manually go into Ubuntu and enable the network
The package networking isn't installed.
Do you have anyone around the server? Have them install the package manually
How? Without networking and a CD?
manually, using a USB drive / floppy / whatever
What package do I want to download?
no clue ask ikonia, I only act like I know what Im doing
I believe you should check whether your Ethernet card is detected altogether
then google and resolve the issue with detecting your ethernet card
